turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Childers Farmstead.
turn.2: Childers Farmstead The Childers Farmstead is a historic farm property in rural southern White County, Arkansas.
turn.4: It is located south of McRae, near the junction of Bowman and Rip Kirk Roads.
turn.6: The farmstead includes three buildings: the main house, a large barn, and a small "Delco house", originally built to house electricity generation equipment provided by Delco Electronics.
turn.8: The main house is a vernacular single story wood frame structure, with a hip roof and a shed-roof porch extending across its main (northern) facade.
turn.9: Is there anything else interesting about the house?
turn.10: That facade is symmetrically arranged, with Craftsman-style windows on either side of the entrance, which is flanked by half-length sidelights.
turn.12: The house was built about 1925, and is an unusual example of a retro version of Greek Revival architecture with Craftsman features.
